page_analysis.text_content:
Gross vs. net lot area

Gross lot area is the size of the lot—from lot line to lot line. Development potential is based on the net lot area and while gross and net lot area are the same for most lots in Palo Alto, there are some lots for which portions must be excluded from the gross lot area to establish the net lot area.

Areas excluded from the gross lot size are:
• Street right-of-way (Area A of Fig 1 on this page)
• "Pole" portion of a flag lot (Area B of Fig 2 on this page)
• Creek channel (Area C of Fig 3 on this page)

Fig 1 Gross lot area exclusions: street easements

The portion of the lot within the public ROW must be subtracted from the gross lot area.

Notes: In some areas of Palo Alto, like Barron Park, it is not unusual for the lot to extend to the middle of the street. However, for zoning purposes, the lot is defined by the edge of the public street easement or public right-of-way (ROW). Dimensions for the public ROW are available at the Development Center.

Fig 2 Gross lot area exclusions: flag-lot "poles"

Flag lot containing private easement
Flag lot with "pole"
"pole" portion of a lot must be subtracted from the gross lot size

* Private access easements to that provide access to lots are NOT subtracted from the lot on which they occur.

Street

Fig 3 Gross lot area exclusions: creek easements

Creek easement

The portion of the lot within a creek channel must be subtracted from gross lot size.

Top of bank

Lot with creek and/or creek easement

Notes: The channel or area to be subtracted is defined by Santa Clara Valley Water District's easement or, if there is no easement, the top-of-bank. Determining the top-of-bank may require a surveyor.

Key
Curb
Sidewalk
Lot lines

Creek
Area that must be subtracted from gross lot area

Street

3

visual_elements.description: Figure 1 showing a lot with boundaries extending into public right-of-way. Shows lot with boundaries that extend into the public ROW, with Area A marked as the portion within public ROW that must be subtracted. Includes labels for 'Lot with boundaries that extend into the public ROW', 'Public ROW', and 'SS' marking.
visual_elements.location: Left side of page, middle section

visual_elements.description: Figure 2 showing flag lot configurations. Two diagrams side by side - left shows 'Flag lot containing private easement', right shows 'Flag lot with pole'. Area B is marked on the pole portion. Includes note about private access easements and shows street at bottom.
visual_elements.location: Right side of page, upper middle section

visual_elements.description: Figure 3 showing creek easement exclusions. Shows a lot with creek channel running through it, with Area C marked as the creek portion to be subtracted. Includes 'Top of bank' label, 'Creek easement' label, and 'Lot with creek and/or creek easement' label. Shows street at bottom.
visual_elements.location: Right side of page, lower section

visual_elements.description: Key showing symbols used in diagrams: hatched lines for Curb/Sidewalk, solid lines for Lot lines, wavy lines for Creek, and shaded areas for 'Area that must be subtracted from gross lot area'

subheadings: Areas excluded from the gross lot size are:
Fig 1 Gross lot area exclusions: street easements
Fig 2 Gross lot area exclusions: flag-lot "poles"
Fig 3 Gross lot area exclusions: creek easements
sections: Three figure sections with explanatory text
